greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of strict integer partitions of n that are empty or such that (1) the smallest part divides every other part and (2) the greatest part is divisible by every other part.
comment: Alternative name: Number of strict integer partitions of n with a part dividing all the others and a part divisible by all the others.
example: 1  2  3   4   5   6   7    8   9    A    B    C     D    E    F
xref: The first condition alone gives A097986.
The non-strict version is A130714 (Heinz numbers are complement of A343343).
The second condition alone gives A343347.
The half-opposite versions are A343380 and A343381.
The strict complement is counted by A343382.
A000070 counts partitions with a selected part.
A006128 counts partitions with a selected position.
A015723 counts strict partitions with a selected part.
A018818 counts partitions into divisors (strict: A033630).
A167865 counts strict chains of divisors > 1 summing to n.
A339564 counts factorizations with a selected factor.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Apr 16 2021
